org.pragmaticminds.crunch.execution

Class KafkaMRecordSource

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.pragmaticminds.crunch.execution.KafkaMRecordSource
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, MRecordSource

    public class KafkaMRecordSource
extends Object
implements MRecordSource
    This class implements the MRecordSource for the use with a KafkaConsumer
    Author:
    Erwin Wagasow Created by Erwin Wagasow on 29.08.2018
    See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • KafkaMRecordSource

        public KafkaMRecordSource(String kafkaUrl,
                          String kafkaGroup,
                          Collection<String> topics)
        Main constructor. Creates a new instance of the KafkaConsumer
        Parameters:
        kafkaUrl - to connect to kafka
        kafkaGroup - to connect to kafka
        topics - List of all to be subscribed

      • KafkaMRecordSource

        public KafkaMRecordSource(String kafkaUrl,
                          String kafkaGroup,
                          Collection<String> topics,
                          boolean fromBeginning)
        Main constructor. Creates a new instance of the KafkaConsumer
        Parameters:
        kafkaUrl - to connect to kafka
        kafkaGroup - to connect to kafka
        topics - List of all to be subscribed
        fromBeginning - If this should read from the beginning of the kafka topics if group is unset

      • KafkaMRecordSource

        public KafkaMRecordSource(String kafkaUrl,
                          String kafkaGroup,
                          Collection<String> topics,
                          Map<String,Object> additionalProperties)
        Main constructor. Creates a new instance of the KafkaConsumer
        Parameters:
        kafkaUrl - to connect to kafka
        kafkaGroup - to connect to kafka
        topics - List of all to be subscribed
        additionalProperties - extra properties to be set up

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public UntypedValues get()
        Request the next record. Poll on KafkaConsumer with Long.MAX_VALUE as timeout.
        Specified by:
        get in interface MRecordSource
        Returns:
        record from KafkaConsumer

      • hasRemaining

        public boolean hasRemaining()
        Check whether more records are available for fetch. In this case always true.
        Specified by:
        hasRemaining in interface MRecordSource
        Returns:
        true if records can be fetched using get(). Always true, because Kafka is a stream and assumed to have infinite records.

      • init

        public void init()
        Is called before first call to hasRemaining() or get(). In this case nothing is to do.
        Specified by:
        init in interface MRecordSource

      • close

        public void close()
        Is called after processing has ended (either by cancelling or by exhausting the source). Closes the consumer provided with the constructor.
        Specified by:
        close in interface MRecordSource

      • getKind

        public MRecordSource.Kind getKind()
        Returns the Kind of the record source.
        Specified by:
        getKind in interface MRecordSource
        Returns:
        Kind of the source. In this case Kind.INFINITE, because Kafka is a stream source and should be infinite.
